snippet: Omar Ishrak defended his company’s $42.9 billion plan to acquire Dublin-based Covidien in a so-called inversion deal, saying the medical device maker will be able to create more jobs in the United States.
abstract: Medtronic chief executive Omar Ishrak defends company's plans to acquire Dublin-based Covidien in so-called inversion deal worth $42.9 billion; insists deal will allow medical device maker to create more jobs in United States while reducing tax burden.
lead_paragraph: Omar Ishrak defended his company’s $42.9 billion plan to acquire Dublin-based Covidien in a so-called inversion deal, saying the medical device maker will be able to create more jobs in the United States.

headline.main: Medtronic Chief Defends Deal for Irish Company
headline.print_headline: Medtronic Chief Defends Deal for Irish Company
